Point¶

class decodes.core.dc_point.Point(a=0, b=0, c=0)¶

Bases: decodes.core.dc_vec.Vec

a simple point class

Point Constructor.

Parameters:
  • a (float) – a value
  • b (float) – b value
  • c (float) – c value
Result :

Point object
Return type:

Point

 
pt_a=Point()

pt_b=Point(1,1)

pt_c=Point(1,1,1)

pts=[Point(i,i,i) for i in range(10)]
static centroid(points)¶

Returns the centroid of a point cloud.

Parameters:points ([Point]) – Point cloud
Result :Centroid of point cloud.
Return type:Point 
Point.centroid(pts)
static cull_duplicates(pts, threshold=None)¶

Discards duplicate points from a list of points.

Parameters:
  • pts (list) – A list of points
  • threshold (float) – Tolerance of difference between points
Result :

List of points without duplicates
Return type:

List

 
Point.cull_duplicates(pts)
distance(other)¶

Returns the distance between this point and the other point in local space. Both points must use the same basis.

Parameters:other (Point) – Point to calculate the distance from
Result :Distance between points
Return type:float 
pt_a.distance(pt_b)
distance2(other)¶

Returns the distance squared between this point and the other point in local space. Both points must use the same basis.

Parameters:other (Point) – Point to calculate the distance from
Result :Distance squared between points
Return type:float 
pt_a.distance2(pt_b)
static far(pt, pts)¶

Returns a point from the given list of points which is furthest from the source point.

Parameters:
  • pt (Point) – Source point
  • pts (Point) – A list of points through which to search
Result :

A point from the list which is furthest from the source point
Return type:

Point

 
Point.far(pt_a, pts)
static far_index(pt, pts)¶

Returns the index of the point within the given list of points which is furthest from the source point.

Parameters:
  • pt (Point) – Source point
  • pts (Point) – A list of points through which to search
Result :

The index of the furthest point
Return type:

int

 
Point.far_index(pt_a, pts)
static interpolate(p0, p1, t=0.5)¶

Returns a new point which is the result of an interpolation between the two given points at the given t-value.

Parameters:
  • p0 (Point) – First point to interpolate
  • p1 (Point) – Second point to interpolate
  • t (float) – t-value of interpolation
Result :

Interpolated point
Return type:

Point

 
Point.interpolate(pt_a, pt_b)

static random(interval=None, constrain2d=False)¶

Returns a random point within the given (optional) range.

Parameters:
  • interval (Interval) – Range to get the random value from.
  • constrain2d (bool) – Constrain the point to 2d space.
Result :

Random point
Return type:

Point

 
Point.random(Interval(0,10))
